title: MJ CySec marketing website (responsive, themed, SEO, contact flow)

requirements.summary: Build a responsive, well-structured MJ CySec marketing site with polished English copy and strong CTAs.
acceptanceCriteria: Site renders correctly on mobile, tablet, and desktop screen sizes.
All user-facing text is in English and consistently branded as “MJ CySec”.
Homepage includes a clear value proposition and at least one prominent call-to-action (e.g., “Request a Consultation”).

file_operations.description: Create the main marketing single-page app layout for “MJ CySec” with responsive sections (Home hero/value prop + primary CTA, Services, About, Contact) and a consistent content structure.

Create a responsive header with MJ CySec branding and a prominent CTA button; use composed shadcn/ui components (e.g., Button) without modifying immutable ui paths. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a footer with MJ CySec branding, short credibility copy, and a secondary CTA; use composed shadcn/ui components (e.g., Button) without modifying immutable ui paths. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Ensure App wiring remains correct for the new marketing site structure and keep the app wrapped in the existing providers (React Query + InternetIdentityProvider) as provided by the template.

requirements.summary: Implement standard marketing sections: Home, Services, About, Contact with navigation and a complete contact form.
acceptanceCriteria: Navigation provides access to Home, Services, About, and Contact.
Services section/page presents at least 3 service offerings with short descriptions.
About section/page includes company overview and mission statement copy (in English).
Contact section/page includes a contact form with name, email, company (optional), and message fields.

file_operations.description: Create the Home section (hero + trust/value props) with English copy for MJ CySec and at least one prominent CTA that scrolls users to the Contact section.

Create a Services section presenting at least 3 MJ CySec offerings (e.g., Security Assessments, Vulnerability Scanning, Compliance Readiness) using composed shadcn/ui cards/badges where appropriate. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create an About section including an MJ CySec overview and mission statement in English, styled consistently with the site design system.

Create a Contact section containing the required form fields (name, email, optional company, message) and a clear submit affordance; compose shadcn/ui form controls without modifying immutable ui paths. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire the four sections into the page in the correct order and connect header navigation links (anchors/scroll) to Home, Services, About, and Contact.

requirements.summary: Implement the contact form submission UX with validation and success/error states, integrating with the existing backend canister contact submission capability.
acceptanceCriteria: Submitting the contact form stores a timestamped submission (name, email, optional company, message) in the backend canister.
UI shows a clear success message after a successful submission and an error message if it fails.
Basic validation prevents empty required fields and invalid email format before submission.
A backend query method exists to list submissions (for future admin use), even if not exposed in the UI.

file_operations.description: Create a hook that uses the existing actor (via useActor) to submit contact messages and exposes loading/success/error state for the Contact UI.

Implement the contact form component with client-side validation (required fields + email format), and clear success/error UI states after submission; compose shadcn/ui inputs/buttons/alerts where available. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire ContactForm into the Contact section and ensure the section displays submission feedback states (success/error) clearly and accessibly.
Align frontend typing usage for the contact submission flow (e.g., required fields and timestamp handling) to match actual app usage; do not introduce new backend capabilities here.

requirements.summary: Apply a cohesive cybersecurity visual theme and design system (avoiding default blue/purple) with accessible interactive states.
acceptanceCriteria: Theme is applied consistently across all pages/sections (buttons, cards, headings, links).
Color palette avoids default blue/purple styling unless required for accessibility states; overall aesthetic fits cybersecurity (e.g., charcoal/black with neon green accents).
All interactive elements have clear hover/focus states and meet basic accessibility expectations (e.g., visible focus ring).

file_operations.description: Create global styles (Tailwind directives + CSS variables if needed) to establish a charcoal/dark base with neon-green accent palette, consistent typography, spacing defaults, and visible focus rings.
Extend Tailwind theme tokens (colors/radius/shadows as needed) to support the MJ CySec dark cyber aesthetic while preserving accessibility states.
Create a reusable layout wrapper that applies consistent section spacing, max-width container usage, and shared background treatments across Home/Services/About/Contact.

Adopt the MarketingLayout wrapper and ensure consistent styled components (buttons/cards/links) are used across all sections without modifying immutable shadcn/ui component sources. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add basic SEO + social sharing metadata and professional document titles for MJ CySec.
acceptanceCriteria: Pages include a meaningful document title (at minimum the homepage).
Meta description and OpenGraph/Twitter metadata are present for the homepage.
Brand name “MJ CySec” appears in the title/metadata.

file_operations.description: Add homepage-focused metadata: updated title, meta description, OpenGraph tags, and Twitter card tags that include the “MJ CySec” brand name and a professional cybersecurity marketing description.
Set/maintain a clean document title in-app (at minimum for the initial render) consistent with MJ CySec branding.

requirements.summary: Add generated brand images as static frontend assets and wire them into header/footer/hero/services.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are placed under frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced directly by the frontend (not served via backend).
Logo appears in the site header and footer.
Hero background/illustration is used on the homepage.
Service icons are displayed alongside service offerings.

file_operations.description: Add the generated MJ CySec wordmark logo as a static asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/mj-cysec-logo.dim_1024x256.png.
Add the generated MJ CySec hero background image as a static asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/mj-cysec-hero-bg.dim_1920x1080.png.
Add the generated service icon set image as a static asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/mj-cysec-service-icons.dim_512x512.png.
Reference and render the logo from frontend/public/assets/generated/mj-cysec-logo.dim_1024x256.png within the header layout (responsive sizing).
Reference and render the logo from frontend/public/assets/generated/mj-cysec-logo.dim_1024x256.png within the footer layout.
Use the hero visual from frontend/public/assets/generated/mj-cysec-hero-bg.dim_1920x1080.png as part of the Home hero background/illustration treatment.
Display service icons alongside service offerings using frontend/public/assets/generated/mj-cysec-service-icons.dim_512x512.png (e.g., consistent cropping/positioning per service card).
